result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Regino Leon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Regino Leon in court with attorney Timothy G. Duffy. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant also subject to hold open in 15FO331. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Guilty plea entered on 15CM388 Count 1. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of 15CM388 Count 1. 
Count 2 is dismissed and read in. 
16CM25 also dismissed and read in. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present 
- expungement upon successful completion of probation 
Advised of appeal rights.
Copy sent to WCSO & Jail Sgt
Mailed Signature Bond to Atty for signature due back in 10 days

Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

District Attorney John Snider : Present
Defendant: Present
Atty Timothy Duffy, Present
Complaint received.  Waive reading of complaint.
Plea Not Guilty
Signature Bond $1000
  Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.
  Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
STC 03/08/16 @ 10:00 am
